body:
Historically, these types have been unabashedly against centralization, authoritarian rule of information, and censorship. They design systems and protocols that prevent authoritarian crackdowns on information.

Remember SOPA and how many of these tech companies went dark in protest of this heavy handed government intervention in the internet?

Why now are those same people folding to neo-facism and blatantly advocating for the censorship of ideas? Why now is it ok to scan images on your iPhone and require a QR code to enter a grocery store while banning those they disagree with on the internet?

What the fuck happened?
body_html:
Historically, these types have been unabashedly against centralization, authoritarian rule of information, and censorship. They design systems and protocols that prevent authoritarian crackdowns on information.

Remember SOPA and how many of these tech companies went dark in protest of this heavy handed government intervention in the internet?

Why now are those same people folding to neo-facism and blatantly advocating for the censorship of ideas? Why now is it ok to scan images on your iPhone and require a QR code to enter a grocery store while banning those they disagree with on the internet?

What the fuck happened?
title: Why are so many tech liberals about censorship now?

body: They've grown up and realized that their ideals don't survive public scrutiny.
body_html: They've grown up and realized that their ideals don't survive public scrutiny.

body:
You can't apply logic to a situation like this. It doesn't make sense.

Remove the logic, and nothing has changed. They only want free speech for themselves. They can still say what they want to say. They want you to be censored so that you can no longer say what you want to say. The only difference is that now they feel they are on the offense.
body_html:

body: Because they hold childishly idealistic views which they have made central to their identities. Attacking these (often contradictory) views is very distressing to them because they take it personally, and if done so effectively will cause them to have an existential crisis. It’s basic self-preservation for them.

body:
Because they aren't for anything. They just align with whatever they think is cool or seem powerful, that's all. Once you understand that it all makes sense.  That's also how you get communism, which really should be called dumb authoritarianism, or maybe even sheepism. Most of these people are technically below 100IQ, guaranteed. Yes, that includes a lot of people with nice titles - a title doesn't make your brain work better, and doesn't even mean you worked hard or had to do anything complicated for it. I'd know, I work with a bunch of highly paid PhD that are frankly technical retards, an have been installed because they're easy to manipulate.

tl;dr for evil to flourish you just need the good people to be too comfortable to get in their way.
body_html:
Because they aren't for anything. They just align with whatever they think is cool or seem powerful, that's all. Once you understand that it all makes sense. That's also how you get communism, which really should be called dumb authoritarianism, or maybe even sheepism. Most of these people are technically below 100IQ, guaranteed. Yes, that includes a lot of people with nice titles - a title doesn't make your brain work better, and doesn't even mean you worked hard or had to do anything complicated for it. I'd know, I work with a bunch of highly paid PhD that are frankly technical retards, an have been installed because they're easy to manipulate.

tl;dr for evil to flourish you just need the good people to be too comfortable to get in their way.

guild.name: AskRuqqus

post.body:
Historically, these types have been unabashedly against centralization, authoritarian rule of information, and censorship. They design systems and protocols that prevent authoritarian crackdowns on information.

Remember SOPA and how many of these tech companies went dark in protest of this heavy handed government intervention in the internet?

Why now are those same people folding to neo-facism and blatantly advocating for the censorship of ideas? Why now is it ok to scan images on your iPhone and require a QR code to enter a grocery store while banning those they disagree with on the internet?

What the fuck happened?
post.body_html:
Historically, these types have been unabashedly against centralization, authoritarian rule of information, and censorship. They design systems and protocols that prevent authoritarian crackdowns on information.

Remember SOPA and how many of these tech companies went dark in protest of this heavy handed government intervention in the internet?

Why now are those same people folding to neo-facism and blatantly advocating for the censorship of ideas? Why now is it ok to scan images on your iPhone and require a QR code to enter a grocery store while banning those they disagree with on the internet?

What the fuck happened?
post.title: Why are so many tech liberals about censorship now?

author.bio: An ugly giant bag of mostly water.
author.bio_html: An ugly giant bag of mostly water.

body: From what I've seen, most of the pro censorship techies only went into tech for the money and power. They got a CS degree because it was reasonably prestigious and carried the guarantee of a good salary, then they went to FAANG if they could fake their way through the tech interview, or shady data brokers and Fortune 50 companies if not. They were against government power when it might hurt their salary, and foolishly we thought it was actually a principled position.
body_html: From what I've seen, most of the pro censorship techies only went into tech for the money and power. They got a CS degree because it was reasonably prestigious and carried the guarantee of a good salary, then they went to FAANG if they could fake their way through the tech interview, or shady data brokers and Fortune 50 companies if not. They were against government power when it might hurt their salary, and foolishly we thought it was actually a principled position.
